Assam Tour Packages

The northeastern state of India, Assam, has a mystical charm to it. Read More

Settled along the eastern Himalayas on the banks of Brahmaputra and Barak river valleys, Assam is truly one of a kind. The rich biodiversity combined perfectly with the unique culture and heritage experiences makes Assam a must-visit. The ancient history of Assam can be dated back to the 1st century and beyond. Ever since the Stone Age, Assam has been the center for cultural and heritage wonders. This is clear through their interesting dresses, delicious cuisines, festivals, beliefs, and traditions. Assam tour packages will be the best way of exploring the natural and cultural side this wonderful state has to offer.

Assam is an iconic part of the 7 sisters of northeastern India. The crowd here is humble and very welcoming towards the tourists. Other than the incredible collection of heritage remnants, Assam is also famous all over the world for its impeccable wildlife reserves and rich biodiversity. An Assam tour itinerary includes a visit to all these wonderful places and more. The pilgrimage circuit in Assam is a whole different story. Offering Darshan at the temples of Kamakhya Devi Temple, Kedareshwara Temple, Ugra Tara Temple, and more or checking out the endangered one-horned rhino in Kaziranga national park or shopping for famous heritage silk weaves, everything you do in Assam is packed with a deep sense of love and admiration.

Road trips are a real treat in Assam. Be it mountain biking on the hills or checking out the incredibly rich biodiversity, Assam is perfect for literally anything and anyone. The best way of having a Sureshot wonderful experience is to choose the IRCTC Assam tour package that includes easy access to most of the famous tourist attractions and experiences in Assam. Crowned with the snowcapped Himalayan peaks and Crisscrossed with streams, and cascading waterfalls and set against the backdrop of humble culture, Assam is an experience like no other.

FAQs for Pilgrimage Tours Packages

Q1: How Much Does It Cost To Visit Assam?

Ans. The cost of visiting Assam can vary based on factors such as the duration of your stay, accommodation preferences, mode of transportation, and the activities you plan to undertake. On average, budget travellers can expect to spend around $50 to $100 per day, while mid-range travellers might budget between $100 to $200. Luxury travel expenses can go beyond $200 per day.

Q2: What Is The Best Time To Visit Assam?

Ans. The best time to visit Assam is during the winter season, from November to April. During this period, the weather is relatively cool and comfortable, making it ideal for exploring the diverse landscapes and cultural attractions. However, specific preferences and activities may influence the choice of the best time, as the monsoon season (June to September) is also popular for lush greenery and vibrant festivals.

Q3: Which Assam Tour Package Is Best?

Ans. The best Assam tour package depends on your interests, budget, and preferred travel style. Several reputable travel agencies offer diverse packages catering to wildlife enthusiasts, cultural explorers, and adventure seekers. It's advisable to compare packages, read reviews, and customize your itinerary based on personal preferences. Popular destinations to include in your package might be Kaziranga National Park, Majuli Island, Guwahati, and the scenic tea gardens of Assam.

Q4: How To Plan A Trip To Assam?

Ans. To plan a trip to Assam, start by determining your preferred travel dates and budget. Research the key attractions, such as Kaziranga National Park and Kamakhya Temple. Consider transportation options and book flights or trains accordingly. Look for accommodations that suit your budget and preferences. Plan an itinerary that includes a mix of cultural experiences, wildlife exploration, and scenic landscapes.
